question.title: Issue with getting Jar dependencies via Jdeps
question.body:
I want to create a JLink image of a jar file of my Java project and I'm using Maven as build tool. I'm trying to get all dependencies needed to run my project to create a JLink image of it by using the command:

jdeps --print-module-deps -cp <classpath> -R --multi-release 17 <jar path>

where I get jar's classpath via the command:

mvn dependency:build-classpath

While I expect to get a list of all dependencies I need to include to my JRE image, I only get a huge list of warnings of the form:

Warning: split package: <package name> <jar address> <package address>

I'm also using a number of third-party libraries and I'm on openJDK-18. What should I do to prevent this error?

I'd be really grateful for any workaround to the problem I'm facing and/or any idea of its cause
